DataElement.preferredName: Transurethral Resection of Bladder Tumor Stage Stratification Factors Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol based on tumor staging after a surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder has been performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transurethral Resection of Bladder Tumor Stage Stratification Factors
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.

Property.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.value: Concurrent CIS and papillary disease (CIS+HGTa or CIS+HGT1)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Concurrent Carcinoma In Situ And Papillary Disease or Disorder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Concurrent Carcinoma In Situ And Papillary Disease or Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time.: A malignant epithelial neoplasm which is confined to the epithelial layer without evidence of further tissue invasion.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: of or relating to or resembling papilla.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
